jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

061F330BDFE8474FAD1AB6013C3B89D3.description:
Analyze maps of human settlement and
routes traveled in the past to determine
the relationship between where people
lived and their movements.

D8AD0137A9BD4DF3B88F35F9D8F12472.description:
Explain, in terms of “push-pull”
factors, the major population
movements that have occurred in the
past and may occur among places and
regions. What was the effect of
religious oppression and religious
tolerance?

6F7119497E82415DA69AB79536D52EE1.description:
Describe how legacies of the past have
affected past and present human
characteristics of places (e.g., wealth
and poverty, exploitation, colonialism
and independence).

700C4DDEC9E94579A013223E8DA847A3.description: Understand the historical significance of geography. Understand the historical significance of geography and the Church.

B85878FE41444F09810AA2C9576D0B00.description:
Understand the moral and religious
obligation to help those affected by
natural disasters. List different ways to
help.

744143DC2E6F45D98D7983E2E679FEF7.description:
Rank natural hazards based on the
degree of impact on people and the
physical environment (e.g., loss of life,
destruction of property, economic
impact, alteration of ecosystems).

7B5669B9DC9E44D0B41061E497D61D55.description:
Explain how human induced alterations
of the environment have resulted in
human migration (e.g., “Okies” from
the Dust Bowl to California, the
expanding Sahara).

0F57F7B6978643B0957571432F684DE6.description:
Analyze rapidly growing urban centers
to determine the impact of urban sprawl
on the physical and human
environment.

C5D388F1ADD84AAC8E57318E0E45F425.description:
Identify reasons related to the natural
environment that influence the location
of certain human activities (e.g., corn
production in Illinois, rice in Southeast
Asia).

F3CD33E1748441F5873B4EE7264C62A3.description:
Identify ways that humankind can
share resources with emphasis on their
responsibility as Catholics.

B886E7F5BEE04269968EA5A09AA56EA2.description:
Explain the patterns of natural resource
distribution (e.g., petroleum, timber) in
various regions of the United States and
the world.

1A690CA7D2E044A2B74C3AD2F55D058C.description: Understand relationships between geographic factors and society. Understand relationships between geographic factors, society and the Church.

56BE5ACF37B6463BB1F219454EB7CC8D.description:
Predict the potential outcomes of the
continued movement of Earth’s
tectonic plates (e.g., continental drift,
earthquakes, volcanic activity).

A4AF2660FC874FB79C61584474BB7DDD.description:
Analyze the causes and effects of
changes over time in physical
landscapes (e.g., forest cover, water
distribution, temperature fluctuations)
as show on maps, graphs, and satellite
produced images.

0F8C32B0F2E548CEBCBAB3FE278C6BB0.description:
Propose ways humankind can preserve
God’s gift of the environment.

84EF90CB8BCF41638E2CF6B370EE8D3D.description:
Hypothesize about the future effects of
the use of technology on Earth’s
physical system (e.g., climate, soil, air,
water).

7D12E9D537EE43418FE9562F4DB0DBE4.description:
Analyze climographs for selected
places and suggest reasons for
similarities and differences in climates.

CBA49A767C454E8B9C0F0D239756C287.description: Analyze and explain characteristics and interactions of the Earth’s physical systems. Analyze and explain the moral implications of our interactions with the Earth’s physical systems.

358D87ACA54F42469DDF0F9AD94C6B7F.description: Trace the origins of the Church.

A2E5B4BB61D545F58BC5BA068FB32F3D.description:
Demonstrate understanding of world
time zones by determining the date and
time in selected cities around the world.

DD8E93FA72E842C5B85761196528728F.description:
Describe the location of places using
the global system of time zones.

9DECC048BB384152B7120947E5C5B4BE.description:
Demonstrate understanding of how to
display spatial information by
constructing maps, graphs, diagrams,
and charts to display spatial
information (e.g., choropleth maps,
climographs, population pyramids).

01869E42CB2840E88EC7FB31100526E4.description:
Translate a map into sketch form to
illustrate relative location of, size of,
and distances between geographic
features (e.g., cities, mountains, rivers).

B3CE26BCA7CB409B986D03F2F60250C2.description: Locate, describe and explain places, regions and features on the Earth. Locate, describe and explain places, regions and features of God’s creation.

9BDED541EDBC410DA5D5932B4ECB7316.description: Understand world geography and the effects of geography on society, with an emphasis on the United States. Understand world geography and the effects of geography and religion on society with an emphasis on the United States.
